notes: There are several main scripts in different subfolders acting as entrypoints, suggesting iterations or stages of the same project.
Most main scripts use Pygame as the UI/game loop framework and instantiate classes like Camera, Player, World, and input/rendering-related helpers, showing modular design.
Minimap logic appears in multiple versions, improving over time from per-frame generation to periodic updates.
Each main script relies on similarly-named companion modules (e.g., camera.py, world.py, player.py) found in the same subfolder.
There are legacy/experimental scripts (e.g., files with names that are dates) not configured as entrypoints.
Entry point evolution traces a refactor path: from 'Classes' structure (20251020), to 'singlescripts' (20251021), to a more robustly modular, joystick-capable system (20251024).
If you want to further develop the most up-to-date version, edit the files under ...\20251024\.
Legacy and experimental files offer useful history or reference for alternative approaches/previous versions.
